plugins.name: POEditor
plugins.description:
What is POEditor?


POEditor is a highly scalable online translation platform and localization management system, designed to bring together developers, product managers, translators, designers and copywriters in their effort of making multilingual software, and to automate the localization workflow.


Trusted by companies like Bosch, Adidas and Ubisoft, POEditor brings transparency to the localization process, boosting productivity and collaboration between product, design and localization teams and helping avoid possible localization bugs.


For more information on the POEditor platform, please visit: https://poeditor.com/


How Figma and POEditor work together


To connect Figma to a POEditor account, enter the API key of that POEditor account in the Figma plugin.


You’ll be able to create new projects on that account using the plugin, or work with projects which already exist in POEditor.


The POEditor plugin for Figma works both ways, so you can send texts from Figma files to POEditor translation projects and fetch translations from POEditor to Figma.


In POEditor, multiple translation options are available: 

  1. assigning your own translators to specific languages, by adding them as contributors
  2. crowdsourcing translations from your community, using public projects
  3. ordering human translation services from integrated language service providers
  4. using machine translation APIs from DeepL, Google or Microsoft


More information on how the POEditor Figma plugin works here.
plugins.tagline: The localization management platform that's easy to use!

plugins.name: Figma to Interactive Prototype: Supademo
plugins.description:
Create realistic, interactive prototypes in minutes, not days. Directly from Figma — for free.


With Supademo's clickable prototype plugin, anyone can create interactive demos, guides, and prototypes in just a few minutes. Whether you're validating a feature, promoting your product, or gather feedback, this plugin is ideal for both designers & non-designers.


How is this different from Figma's built-in prototyping?

  1. Guided Walkthrough: add animated, on-screen captions that guide customers with each step. Customize colors, design, and link to other screens in seconds.
  2. Trackable: embed online, share as a link, or create personalized links to track views, viewers, sessions, step dropoffs, and more.
  3. More Interactive: add additional interactive elements like voiceovers, zoom, forms, calendars, and chapters for maximum engagement.


Benefits

  1. No code or design skills needed: No need to wait for designers to create interactive prototypes. Marketers, sales, customer success, and product managers can create interactive prototypes in seconds.
  2. Get everyone on the same page: visually prototype new designs, features, and workflow with streamlined communication & clarity. Share internally AND externally for maximum impact!
  3. Ease of sharing & tracking: Share with anyone that matters through a personalized link, inline embed, or MP4/GIF export. Also, know exactly who engages with your interactive prototype.


Getting started

  1. Select the frames you’d like to export to Supademo.
  2. Add text annotations that describe each step - i.e. “Let’s explore the analytics by clicking the Metrics tab.”
  3. Click “Create a Supademo” to generate an editable link.
  4. Add voiceovers, email gating, passwords, animations, branding, conditional branching and more to personalize your interactive demo or guided walkthrough.
  5. Share and embed your first Supademo anywhere - all while tracking unique viewers, engagement, dropoffs and more!


First time?

Try the Supademo plugin for Figma with this example file. Or learn how the prototype works by viewing this interactive demo.


Both this plugin and Supademo are completely free to use. Sign up here to get started with creating interactive prototypes.
plugins.tagline: Transform existing Figma designs into realistic, shareable prototypes in minutes — not days.

plugins.name: Create Table from data
plugins.description:
Creates a table from tab-delimited data, similar to Storybook's prop table design. Probably very buggy. A WIP proof-of-concept.


Inputs explained below:

'How many wide cols?': Determines how many columns should be 2x width


'Count from start?': Determines whether it should count the cols from left or right when determining the wide ones. (can't select individual cols atm)


'Monostyle certain cols': Determines which column text items should be in an imitated codeblock style. Takes a comma-delimited string of column names.


tag inside?: WIP. Will eventually move the monostyled tag inside of another column item. Right now you can use it to hide columns, if the column name is the first item in the [].


Input me:

this is where you copypasta your data.
plugins.tagline: Creates a table from copypasta'd excel data/tab-delimited data

plugins.name: Run GitHub Actions workflows
plugins.description:
Run GitHub Actions workflows directly within Figma, using the selected page and nodes as inputs.



Setup for GitHub


Begin by creating a GitHub Actions workflow.


Configure your workflow to run on workflow_dispatch event:

on:
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      fileKey:
        description: Figma file key
        type: string
        required: true
      page:
        description: Stringified selected page (id, name)
        type: string
        default: '{}'
        required: true
      selection:
        description: Stringified array of the selected nodes (id, name)
        type: string
        default: '[]'
        required: true

As previously mentioned, the plugin triggers the workflow sending the fileKey, the selected page, and the list of selected nodes as selection.


You can then configure the workflow according to your needs. To get started, you can use this example from-figma.yaml.


You can also manipulate the received inputs as needed. Refer to this working example.



Setup for Figma


Setting up in Figma is simple:

  1. Run this plugin.
  2. Enter the fileKey.
  3. Setup a new workflow by clicking the + button (you'll also need a GitHub access token).


Finally, select a page and one or more nodes, and then click ▶. This will run the selected workflow, passing your selection as workflow inputs.



Figma Export PDFs


What do you think about exporting Figma content as PDF document to an FTP Server, just by clicking a button within Figma? Would it be cool, isn't it?


Check out this workflow and discover how it's entirely feasible. Simply clone the workflow and setup this Figma plugin 😉.
plugins.tagline: Run GitHub Actions workflows directly within Figma, using the selected page and nodes as inputs.

plugins.name: Figma to Justinmind
plugins.description:
Export your designs to Justinmind and turn them into hi-fi prototypes and simulations


Justinmind is an advanced prototyping tool with powerful interaction design capabilities that allows you to create and simulate realistic web and mobile apps that mirror the final product to validate and get feedback.


Exporting frames from Figma to Justinmind allows you to quickly and efficiently turn them into wireframes or high fidelity prototypes. This free plugin gives you great control to export Figma projects to Justinmind. So whether you want to export your entire project or just selected design frames, the plugin will allow you to easily export your assets and frames.


Get help


Discover how to use it here: exporting from Figma to Justinmind.


If you have any questions, bug reports or feature requests, feel free to contact us at the Justinmind community support.

accepted.name: Justinmind
accepted.description: Justinmind is an advanced interaction design and prototyping tool that allows you to design and simulate realistic web and mobile apps

plugins.name: Copy and Paste Autolayout
plugins.description:
Is it possible to copy & paste autolayout parameters alone without other properties? If so then this plugin was a waste of time. If no — enjoy 🥳


Usage:

  1. Select one frame / instance / component
  2. In plugins menu select "Copy & Paste Autolayout"->"Copy Autolayout"
  3. Select another destination frame / instance / component
  4. In plugins menu select "Copy & Paste Autolayout"->"Paste Autolayout"


I'm not a dev, so might be buggy. In case of emergency drop me a message.

plugins.name: Button Smith
plugins.description:
Welcome to Create Buttons Component, designed to save you 30 to 60 minutes on button creation. Say goodbye to manually building Primary, Secondary, and Tertiary buttons, along with their Rest, Hover, and Disabled states.


💡 How to use Create Buttons Component?

  1. Choose your settings: Define your button's font, padding, size, border radius, and colors.
  2. Activate the Create Buttons Component Plugin: Simply input your preferences and let the plugin do the rest.
  3. Generate your buttons: The plugin will automatically create a comprehensive set of button components with all necessary states.


🎯 Key Features:

  1. Time-saving automation
  2. Comprehensive button types: Automatically includes Primary, Secondary, and Tertiary buttons.
  3. All states included: Creates Rest, Hover, and Disabled states for each button type.
  4. Customizable settings: Define your font, padding, size, border radius, and colors to match your design system.
  5. Organized output UI


✨ Upcoming Updates:

  1. Buttons with right and left side icons
  2. News button states like, Focus State and Error State


Create Buttons Component is a premium Figma plugin designed to streamline your design process. With Create Buttons Component, you get a comprehensive and consistent set of buttons tailored to your design needs in just a few clicks. It's the perfect tool for designers looking to optimize their workflow and ensure consistency across their projects.


Got ideas on how we can improve Create Buttons Component? We'd love to hear from you. Feel free to drop us an email at hello@kalki.design. Thank you!

plugins.name: Vizard -> Design handoff for marketers
plugins.description:
Join the top brands and agencies using Vizard to scale their creatives.


✅ Handoff ✅ Personalization at scale ✅ Creative Automation


Designers

Look, we know your time is precious!

You don't enjoy talking to the marketing fellas, do you? They want you to center-align a triangle in a circle; they don't really know what a visual center is!


Vizard lets you keep control of design guidelines while saving you all the time of going back & forth with marketers.


You already handled the developers with Figma/Zeplin, good job! 👏 Marketers are your mile. This is your true fire & forget!


Features

  • Handoff designs to other stakeholders while keeping your Figma designs intact
  • Seamlessly collaborate with marketers
  • Save your precious time by doing things ONCE!


Now, please skip the next section. Promise?


Marketers

Here is our little secret - We really made Vizard for you! Sssshhh..! We are giving you control to own your assets & the freedom to make unlimited versions of them without bothering the designers. No need to learn a design software & yet be able to generate thousands of variations on-brand!


Features

  • Scale your design workflow
  • Generate unlimited variations without involving designers
  • No need for design knowledge or extra training


How to use

  1. Sign-up on https://studio.vizardapps.com
  2. Install Vizard Figma Plugin
  3. Select one or more Frames that you would like to share with the marketing team, run the plugin
  4. (First time only) Click on 'Connect Vizard'. It will open authorization page in browser. Click on 'Authorize Figma'
  5. If the preview looks good, click 'Send to Vizard'. That's it!
  6. The design will be available to you & your marketing team under Your Templates on https://studio.vizardapps.com


Known issues

  • Mixed styling in text is currently not supported
  • Currently, only Google fonts are supported. All non-google fonts are converted to Fira Sans font
  • Figma Arrow elements get imported as straight lines
  • Only outside stroke is supported. Inside & center strokes get converted to outside strokes


For questions & suggestions, please reach out to us at hello@vizardapps.com


Learn more about Vizard at www.vizardapps.com

plugins.name: Dynamic Variables
plugins.description:
We all know how tedious it can be to manually update variables in Figma! Especially when you have a lot of them, and they depend on each other. I feel your pain, like when you have to update all 20 shades of the base primary color for two modes.


But don't worry! There's a solution.


Meet "Dynamic Variables," a plugin that automates the process and saves your precious time! The plugin is really handy because it lets you write code expressions in your variables. These are then updated dynamically based on other variables, which means you can spend less time doing manual work and more time being creative! 🎨


🔑 Key Features:


  1. ⚙️ Dynamic Variables: variables that are dynamically updated based on other variables. Use JavaScript expressions between double curly braces {{ expression }} to define the relationship between variables. For example, a variable C can be defined as {{ $A + $B }}, where A and B are references to other variables. Expressions can be any valid JavaScript code written directly in the description field of the variable, making it easy to use.
  2. 🕒 Two Working Modes of the plugin to update variables:
  3. 1. Start Monitoring Changes. The plugin can continuously monitor changes in the variables and update them in real time. You can manually Pause/Resume the plugin to control the update process. You can set a custom time interval between updates according to your needs.
  4. 2. Update Once. Just manually trigger an update whenever needed.
  5. 🎨 Color Manipulation: The plugin uses the amazing colord library by Vlad Shilov, which allows you to perform advanced color manipulations like converting color formats, generating random colors, and more. For example: {{ cd($color).lighten(0.2) }} - to lighten the color by 20%. With the latest update, you can also use culori library functions. The plugin uses the shorthand cl for culori and cv for culori.converter() to make it easier to use. For example: #️⃣ luminance: {{ cl.wcagLuminance($brand) }} - to get the WCAG luminance of the color, or 🎨 oklch-clamp: {{ cl.clampRgb(cv("oklch(90% 0.4 135)")) }} - to parse OKLCH and clamp the color to the displayable gamut in Figma. You can also use Figma's built-in rgba() function to parse colors in the same way as in Figma color input fields, for example: 🎨 color: {{ rgba("green") }}.
  6. ❌ Error Handling: The plugin provides detailed error messages for a variety of problems, including cyclic dependencies, invalid characters in variable references, and more.
  7. 📚 Library Variables: The plugin supports variables from libraries. With the current version you can bring team variables with aliases to your local variables and use them in expressions. Support for direct lookup of team library variables is coming soon.
  8. 🔗 Automatic Reference Updates: The plugin automatically fixes references to renamed or moved variables, ensuring that your dynamic variables are always stay up-to-date and error-free.
  9. 🛠️ Advanced Features: The plugin offers a number of advanced features, for example, you can reference variable's data, such as name, id, collection, modes, etc. in the expressions. This allows you to create more complex and dynamic relationships between variables. E.g. you can have different logic for different modes: {{ ("$$.mode" == "Mobile" ? 1 : 2) * $base-padding }}. See complete list of possible $$ related properties here.
  10. 🗂️ Relative Paths: With the latest update, you can reference variables from the same or neighboring groups without needing to specify the full path to the variable. See examples here.
  11. Note: Relative paths are disabled by default. You can enable them in the plugin settings: Dynamic Variables -> Configure -> Toggle Relative Paths. The auto-reference update feature doesn't work with relatively referenced variables yet.
  12. 🔄 Pre-Processing: The plugin supports code pre-processing. You can use $( ... ) to define a pre-processed expression. For example:
  13. 1. Define color variables 🎨 brand: #FF0000, 🎨 accent: #00FF00, and 🎨 background: #0000FF.
  14. 2. Create dynamic color variables 🎨 brand-50, 🎨 accent-25, and 🎨 background-75 with the same expression in the description: {{ cd($( "$" + "$$".match(/[a-zA-Z]+/)[0] )).alpha(parseInt("$$".match(/\d+/)[0]) / 100) }}.
  15. 3. Try renaming the color and number parts of them and see how they change automatically!
  16. Note: Pre-processed expressions are disabled by default. You can enable them in the plugin settings: Dynamic Variables -> Configure -> Toggle Pre-Process.


You can use the plugin for free with some limitations:


Up to 5 dynamic variables for free forever

More than 5 dynamic variables for free during the 7 or 14 days trial period (depends on the license variant)


To unlock all features and support the development of the plugin, consider purchasing a Pro version. 💳


Buy Pro License


  1. Super Early Bird Discount Code: UZNJQYNG (-$50, First 10 buyers of Unlimited License, Sold Out, 0 left)
  2. Early Bird Discount Code: A3NDI3OQ (-$30, Next 20 buyers of Unlimited License, Sold Out, 0 left)
  3. Subscribe to get notified


Subscribe for updates


Use Dynamic Variables -> Pro License -> Activate key to paste your key and activate after purchase.


You can activate your license on up to 5 instances, or 10 for the Unlimited version. Don't forget to deactivate if you plan to uninstall Figma or reinstall OS, but don't worry I can reset this amount if all activations were done by you.


Please don't hesitate to contact me with any feedback or suggestions. I'd love to hear how you're using Dynamic Variables and what your needs are for future updates!


Here are some common use cases for Dynamic Variables:


  1. 🎨 Color Palettes: Create dynamic color palettes that automatically update based on a few base colors. 🎨 primary-600: {{ cd($base-color).darken(0.1) }}
  2. 📏 Spacing System: Define a spacing system with a base value and create dynamic spacing values based on it. #️⃣ spacing-s: {{ $base-spacing * 2 }}
  3. 🖋️ Typography: Create dynamic typography styles that adjust line height, font size, and other properties based on a base font size. #️⃣ heading-md: {{ Math.round( $heading-sm * 1.2 ) }}
  4. 📱 Localization: Use dynamic variables to reuse parts in different texts. For example, you can define a variable 🔤 user-name: Neil and use it in another variables 🔤 welcome-message: {{ "Hello, $user-name" + "!" }} & 🔤 goodbye-message: {{ "Goodbye, $user-name" + "!" }}.
  5. 🎬 Live Prototyping: Use dynamic variables to create interactive prototypes. For example, you can display the real current time or date in your design 🔤 current-time: {{ new Date().toLocaleTimeString("en-GB") }}. Or grab some data from the API and display it in your design. #️⃣ btc-price: {{ (() => new Promise((resolve) => fetch("https://api.coinbase.com/v2/prices/BTC-USD/buy").then((r) => r.json().then((v) => resolve(v.data.amount))))) }}
  6. 🧠 Conditional Logic: Use dynamic variables to create conditional logic in your design. For example, you can show or hide elements based on the value of a variable ⏺️ desktop-icon-visibility: {{ $max-width > $base-mobile-width }}.
  7. 💡 Your Use Case: The possibilities are endless! Share your use cases in the comments below! 💬


🔗 Links (WIP):

  1. 🛝 Playground file (Soon)
  2. 📖 Documentation (Soon)
  3. ✨ LLM Prompt to help building expressions (Soon)
  4. 🎨 Figma Forum Post (Soon)

plugins.name: テキスト校正くん
plugins.description:
アートボード内の選択中のテキストに対して、文章校正を行います。

一般的な文章のルールに沿って、主に以下のようなチェックを行います。

  • ウェブの用語や名称の表記統一（Javascript → JavaScript、Gitghub → GitHub等）
  • 「ですます」調と「である」調の混在
  • ら抜き言葉
  • 二重否定
  • 同じ助詞の連続使用
  • 同じ接続詞の連続使用
  • 逆接の接続助詞「が」の連続使用
  • 全角と半角アルファベットの混在
  • 弱い日本語表現の利用（〜かもしれない）
  • 読点の数（1文に3つまで）
  • 漢字の閉じ方、開き方（下さい → ください、出来る → できる等）


Performs text editing on the currently selected Japanese text in the artboard.

Following the general rules of text, the following are the main checks to be performed.

  • Unification of web terms and names (Javascript → JavaScript, Gitghub → GitHub, etc.)
  • Mixing of "ですます" and "である" styles
  • Words without "ら"
  • Double negation
  • Continuous use of the same particle
  • Continuous use of the same conjunction
  • Continuous use of the inverse conjunctive particle "が"
  • Mixing full-size and half-size alphabets
  • Use of weak Japanese expressions ("〜かもしれない")
  • Number of punctuation marks (no more than three per sentence)
  • Properly converting Kanji or Hiragana ("下さい" → "ください", "出来る" → "できる", etc.)

plugins.name: 字号缩放工具 Font Size Scale
plugins.description:
缩放大师：Figma 动态缩放字号工具

Scale Master: Font Size Dynamic Zoom Tool for Figma


通过缩放大师，这款强大的插件，提升您的 Figma 使用体验，它设计用于轻松缩放项目中的文本和元素。凭借直观的控制和实时反馈机制，缩放大师确保设计缩放的精确性和效率。

Enhance your Figma experience with Scale Master, a powerful plugin designed to effortlessly scale text and elements across your projects. With intuitive controls and real-time feedback mechanisms, Scale Master ensures precision and efficiency in design scaling.


功能特点：

  1. 动态缩放： 通过简单的滑块控制轻松调整文本和元素大小。
  2. 实时反馈： 对缩放操作提供即时的视觉和文本反馈，确保精确性和满意度。
  3. 可自定义设置： 微调缩放参数以满足特定项目需求。
  4. 用户友好界面： 干净直观的用户界面，无缝集成到您的 Figma 工作区。

Features:

  1. Dynamic Scaling: Easily adjust text and element sizes with a simple slider control.
  2. Real-Time Feedback: Instant visual and textual feedback on scaling operations, ensuring accuracy and satisfaction.
  3. Customizable Settings: Fine-tune scaling parameters to meet specific project needs.
  4. User-Friendly Interface: A clean and straightforward UI that seamlessly integrates into your Figma workspace.


非常适合希望简化工作流程并在不同设备大小上实现一致设计结果的设计师和团队。

Perfect for designers and teams looking to streamline their workflow and achieve consistent design results across different device sizes.


立即获取缩放大师，前所未有地掌控您的设计缩放！

Get Scale Master today and take control of your design scales like never before!

accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Effortlessly scale designs to fit any screen size.

plugins.name: Sessions
plugins.description:
Showcase your artwork live in meetings with Sessions



Meeting collaboration tool meets vector graphics editor

Figma users worldwide are now able to showcase their designs during a virtual meeting powered by Sessions. Sessions is not just another video conferencing app. It is the platform that makes meetings better by bringing all your collaboration tools into one single space.


When it is time to present or ask a colleague for an opinion on your Figma project, it is dead easy to share it with them. When organizing a meeting in Sessions, in the agenda of the meeting where you design the time slots, it is now possible to dedicate time to display a Figma project in the meeting without having to share your screen. The best part of Sessions is that you can access all the other functionalities (taking notes, uploading resources) as well, in order to have a complete, engaging and productive meeting.


The wireframes are available in Sessions as static pictures displayed one after the other in the order added when exporting. All the participants present in the meeting are able to view the wireframes. 


With Sessions, there is no time like the present to share your prototype:

To be able to enjoy this capability, register an account with Sessions as well. Open an account free of charge with Sessions by accessing https://sessions.us.


Getting started:

  1. On your Figma design, add the Sessions plug-in. Click on Sync with Sessions. See details, here (https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/360040450413-Find-and-install-plugins ).
  2. The Sessions log-in page is displayed. If you are already logged in, you are asked for permissions.
  3. Export the wireframes you wish to present in the meeting. They are imported as resources in Sessions.
  4. Access Sessions with your newly created account. Create a From Scratch meeting and add the agenda block.
  5. Select for the agenda block the artifact Figma. Choose the wireframes recently exported. 
  6. Publish the session. That’s it!


This is what a sessions looks like: https://youtu.be/VNVg_aD1NPc


Join Sessions’ Slack community at https://join.slack.com/t/sessionscommunity/shared_invite/zt-rsbysxs3-00rRoSXKiAz6bLU6QLy8NQ


Subscribe to our YouTube channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCmkBi4amiGhE68Q8RZVoAPw

Toktoken is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the extraction of design tokens defined within your Figma design system.


With Toktoken, you can easily extract tokens for colors and typography and export them into a structured JSON format. This plugin enables designers and developers to maintain consistency across design and development workflows by providing a centralized source of truth for design tokens.

plugins.name: eval()
plugins.description:
Calculators are dead. 💀 Do math and run code right on the canvas inside Figma files! ✨ Select a text layer, frame or group and run the plugin, the result of the last line expression will be printed on canvas below the expression.


Send the plugin link to your friends: https://figma.fun/eval 🔗


Copy examples below, paste them as separate text objects in your file and run the plugin.


Evaluate an expression (RIP calculators 💀)

75 + 69 * 5


Generate a random number [0-100]

Math.round(Math.random() * 100)


Count all layers in the file (don't run in large files!)

figma.root.findAll(n => true).length


Tips:

  1. You can select multiple objects to run at once but each layer will run in a separate function and the variables won't be shared across.
  2. The code is written in JavaScript.
  3. You can access all Figma API methods within the code.
  4. Write code in text blocks, code blocks, stickies and shapes with text (last three only in FigJam).
  5. Select groups or frames to run all the code inside. Except for output nodes, which would be updated with the new calculation result.
  6. If you want to see output, the last line in the text box should be an expression that returns a value (examples: 5 + 5, myfunc(), x) and not a statement (such as const p = 4).
  7. Add // at the beginning of the text node so it's treated as a comment and doesn't produce a result.
  8. Add = at the end of the expression so the result is printed in the same text, for example: 5 + 5 = would be turned into 5 + 5 = 10.
  9. The node with code can be hidden or transparent and the result would be still printed visible. This is useful if you want to not clutter the file with code.
  10. If your code throws an error, it will be printed in red.
  11. The plugin works similar to notebooks in Python or other interpreted languages.


Tips, questions and feedback are welcome in the comments!
plugins.tagline: RIP calculators!💀 Do math and code right on the canvas.

plugins.name: PlaceCattos
plugins.description:
Transform your design from meh to meow with a few simple steps.


  1. Select a frame, shape or image
  2. Run PlaceCattos plugin
  3. Meow to your new fur friend


Don't let your designs go to the dogs. Replace those placeholders with cat-tastic cuteness.


If the plugin stops working, it means I've exceeded the API limit. No more meows 😢


Buy me a coffee to support more such projects.

Your support helps me create more purrfect projects for you!


Inspired by Placedoggo plugin. Why should dogs have all the fun?

plugins.name: FlagFetch
plugins.description:
Flagfetch plugin library includes flags from all countries in the world. It includes all regions/continent , and some locations or locales that may not have "official" country status.


The flags are great for communicating where your app, company or service operates and it comes in both PNG and SVG format for your convenience.


Features

1. Run FlagsKit plugin

2. Search by name or country code

3. Click on the flag

4. Choose format type (PNG or SVG)

5. Import of design file or frame


Popular FlagFetch Flag icons:

* Country flags

* International flags

* State and province flags

* Island flags

*


Kindly show some love by dropping a comment.
plugins.tagline: All in one Flag Library

plugins.name: Favicon Generator
plugins.description:
With this plugin, you can easily export Favicons, App Icons, and the associated HTML meta tags based on your current node selection. This tool is similar to other online favicon generators, except you can conveniently do it directly from within Figma.


To start, load the plugin, select the frame and hit Create. Any problems can be reported on the issue tracker.

accepted.name: James Ives
accepted.description: Lover of all things front-end, design and automation.

plugins.name: Meeting Notes
plugins.description:
Allows you to take notes in a single window and stores the text on the canvas for everyone to see.


  1. Select any text frame. (does not create frames.)
  2. Edit text in plugin window (plain text and single level unordered lists only)
  3. Keeps notes visible while you present & drag canvas around
